tooltip: The aquatic impassability score for the road-stream crossing (0 = Completely Passable, 1 = Impassable)
Type of stream crossing (bridge, culvert, multiple culvert, etc.)
Responsibility for road maintenance at crossing
National Highway System status of road at crossing
Drainage area (square kilometers) of all upstream reaches
Stream length (kilometers) of all upstream reaches
Total number of upstream structures crossing the stream
The slope of the stream reach containing the crossing
The predicted two-year high discharge value determined using the Jacob's regime equation for gravel dominated stream beds
The total energy exerted by the stream divided by the width of the stream determined using Q2 discharge and bankful width
Risk of hydraulic failure for the stream crossing (0 = Low, 1 = High)
Risk of structural failure for the stream crossing (0 = Low, 1 = High)
Risk of geomorphic failure for the stream crossing (0 = Low, 1 =  High)
Maximum value for hydrologic, structural, and geomorphic risk of failure (0 = Low, 1 = High)
Average traffic delay for emergency medical services throughout the watershed, if the road is closed due to crossing failure
Average traffic delay for emergency medical services for trips using the crossing, if the road is closed due to crossing failure
Maximum traffic delay for emergency medical services, if the road is closed due to crossing failure
Integrated metric that combines overall connectivity restoration potential (for all streams) and Coldwater (16 C) restoration potential (for cold water streams)

Integrated metric that combines frequency of use by EMS and potential delays for each trip (0 = Least affected, 1 = Most affected) (sum of all logistically converted trip delays transformed by the natural logarithm and scaled to most affected crossing)
Loss of aquatic connectivity caused by crossing impassibility
Potential for improved aquatic connectivity via crossing replacement (connectivity loss weighted by habitat quality)
Potential for improved aquatic connectivity of coldwater streams (below 16 C average summer temperature) via crossing replacement (connectivity loss weighted by habitat quality) 0 = Low, 1 = High
Potential for improved aquatic connectivity of coldwater streams (below 18 C average summer temperature) via crossing replacement (connectivity loss weighted by habitat quality)  0 = Low, 1 = High
Potential for improved aquatic connectivity of coldwater streams (below 20 C average summer temperature) via crossing replacement (connectivity loss weighted by habitat quality)  0 = Low, 1 = High
Date the crossing was field assessed (NA indicates crossing has not been field assessed)
Transportation system vulnerability score that combines the Overall EMS delay score (criticality) and Overall Risk of Failure score (risk)
Crossing prioritization score that combines the maximum value of the Ecological Disruption and Transportation Vulnerability scores (0 = Low, 1 = High)
The unique identifier of the catchment in which the stream crossing is located
The unique identifier of the stream crossing
The NAACC XY identifier (culverts and bridges) or TNC identifier (dams) of the stream crossing
Percentage of the catchment used for agriculture
Average elevation (meters) of the catchment
Percentage of the catchment covered with forest
Percentage of the catchment covered with impervious surface
Average hillside slope (percent) of the catchment
Percentage of the catchment covered with water
The unique identifier of the catchment
Stream order (Strahler method) of stream reach
Probability that the stream reach is suitable for brook trout
Average predicted summer temperature (degrees C) of stream reach
Predicted resistance of stream temperature to changes in air temperature (0 = Low, 1 = High)
The unique identifier of the catchment (in which the stream centroid is located)
The unique identifier of the stream
The unique identifier of the first point of the stream reach
The unique identifier of the last point of the stream reach
